q: Don't let your learning lead to knowledge. Let your learning lead to action.
h:
“Don't let your learning lead to knowledge. Let your learning lead to action.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Leadership is solving problems
h:
“Leadership is solving problems” —
Colin Powell

q: Go for it now. The future is promised to no one.
h:
“Go for it now. The future is promised to no one. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: It is passion that makes man live; wisdom makes one only last.
h:
“It is passion that makes man live; wisdom makes one only last.” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: The golden opportunity you are seeking is in yourself. It is not in your environment; it is not in luck or chance, or the help of others; it is in yourself alone.
h:
“The golden opportunity you are seeking is in yourself. It is not in your environment; it is not in luck or chance, or the help of others; it is in yourself alone. ” —
Orison Swett Marden

q: Anyone who stops learning is old, whether at twenty or eighty. Anyone who keeps learning stays young.
h:
“Anyone who stops learning is old, whether at twenty or eighty. Anyone who keeps learning stays young. ” —
Henry Ford

q: Success does not consist in never making mistakes but in never making the same one a second time.
h:
“Success does not consist in never making mistakes but in never making the same one a second time.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: What we call the beginning is often the end. And to make an end is to make a beginning. The end is where we start from.
h:
“What we call the beginning is often the end. And to make an end is to make a beginning. The end is where we start from.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: One always begins to forgive a place as soon as it's left behind.
h:
“One always begins to forgive a place as soon as it's left behind.” —
Charles Dickens

q: He who has overcome his fears will truly be free.
h:
“He who has overcome his fears will truly be free.” —
Aristotle

q: Do you have the patience to wait until your mud settles and the water is clear?
h:
“Do you have the patience to wait until your mud settles and the water is clear?” —
Lao Tzu

q: The best fighter is never angry.
h:
“The best fighter is never angry.” —
Lao Tzu

q: The dream is free, but the hustle is sold separately.
h:
“The dream is free, but the hustle is sold separately.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Great thoughts speak only to the thoughtful mind, but great actions speak to all mankind.
h:
“Great thoughts speak only to the thoughtful mind, but great actions speak to all mankind.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: The thing about smart people is that they seem like crazy people to dumb people.
h:
“The thing about smart people is that they seem like crazy people to dumb people.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: The biggest and only critic lives in your perception of people's perception of you rather than people's perception of you.
h:
“The biggest and only critic lives in your perception of people's perception of you rather than people's perception of you.” —
Criss Jami

q: Be still when you have nothing to say; when genuine passion moves you, say what you've got to say, and say it hot.
h:
“Be still when you have nothing to say; when genuine passion moves you, say what you've got to say, and say it hot.” —
D. H. Lawrence

q: Don't ever be afraid to put yourself in a lesser position so that you can learn something from someone who knows more.
h:
“Don't ever be afraid to put yourself in a lesser position so that you can learn something from someone who knows more.” —
Steve Harvey

q: I admire those who do good and expect nothing in return.
h:
“I admire those who do good and expect nothing in return.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: A warrior does not give up what he loves, he finds the love in what he does.
h:
“A warrior does not give up what he loves, he finds the love in what he does.” —
Dan Millman

q: Life must be a constant education; one must learn everything, from speaking to dying.
h:
“Life must be a constant education; one must learn everything, from speaking to dying.” —
Gustave Flaubert

q: When reading, only read. When eating, only eat. When thinking, only think.
h:
“When reading, only read. When eating, only eat. When thinking, only think.” —
Seungsahn

q: The universe doesn't give you what you ask for with your thoughts - it gives you what you demand with your actions.
h:
“The universe doesn't give you what you ask for with your thoughts - it gives you what you demand with your actions.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
h:
“Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.” —
Thomas Edison

q: The world only exists in your eyes. You can make it as big or as small as you want.
h:
“The world only exists in your eyes. You can make it as big or as small as you want.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: Everything is created twice, first in the mind and then in reality.
h:
“Everything is created twice, first in the mind and then in reality.” —
Robin Sharma

q: If you put yourself in a position where you have to stretch outside your comfort zone, then you are forced to expand your consciousness.
h:
“If you put yourself in a position where you have to stretch outside your comfort zone, then you are forced to expand your consciousness.” —
Unknown

q: Happiness comes when you believe in what you are doing, know what you are doing, and love what you are doing.
h:
“Happiness comes when you believe in what you are doing, know what you are doing, and love what you are doing.” —
Brian Tracy

q: A man has to learn that he cannot command things but that he can command himself; that he cannot coerce the wills of others but that he can mold and master his own will.
h:
“A man has to learn that he cannot command things but that he can command himself; that he cannot coerce the wills of others but that he can mold and master his own will.” —
James Allen

q: May you find grace as you surrender to life. May you find happiness, as you stop seeking it.
h:
“May you find grace as you surrender to life. May you find happiness, as you stop seeking it.” —
Dan Millman

q: It's easier to lose than to win.
h:
“It's easier to lose than to win. ” —
Wayne Gretzky

q: Treat every moment as your last. It is not preparation for something else.
h:
“Treat every moment as your last. It is not preparation for something else.” —
Shunryu Suzuki

q: No need to hurry. No need to sparkle. No need to be anybody but oneself.
h:
“No need to hurry. No need to sparkle. No need to be anybody but oneself.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: The secret of happiness, you see, is not found in seeking more, but in developing the capacity to enjoy less.
h:
“The secret of happiness, you see, is not found in seeking more, but in developing the capacity to enjoy less.” —
Dan Millman

q: You win more from losing than winning.
h:
“You win more from losing than winning.” —
Morgan Wootten

q: A thing must be loved before it is lovable.
h:
“A thing must be loved before it is lovable.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: It is important that we forgive ourselves for making mistakes. We need to learn from our errors and move on.
h:
“It is important that we forgive ourselves for making mistakes. We need to learn from our errors and move on.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: Bad things are not the worst things that an happen to us. NOTHING is the worst thing that can happen to us.
h:
“Bad things are not the worst things that an happen to us. NOTHING is the worst thing that can happen to us.” —
Richard Bach

q: Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence.
h:
“Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence. ” —
George Washington

q: Debt is the slavery of the free.
h:
“Debt is the slavery of the free.” —
Publilius Syrus

q: It is literally true that you can succeed best and quickest by helping others succeed.
h:
“It is literally true that you can succeed best and quickest by helping others succeed.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much.
h:
“Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much. ” —
Oscar Wilde

q: Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree.
h:
“Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree. ” —
Martin Luther

q: Life goes by fast. Enjoy it. Calm down. It's all funny.
h:
“Life goes by fast. Enjoy it. Calm down. It's all funny.” —
Joan Rivers

q: Fear is stupid. So are regrets.
h:
“Fear is stupid. So are regrets.” —
Marilyn Monroe

q: Much learning does not teach understanding.
h:
“Much learning does not teach understanding.” —
Heraclitus

q: It's better to dance than to march through life.
h:
“It's better to dance than to march through life.” —
Yoko Ono

q: The more you are motivated by Love, The more Fearless & Free your action will be.
h:
“The more you are motivated by Love, The more Fearless & Free your action will be.” —
Dalai Lama

q: Values are like fingerprints. Nobody's are the same, but you leave 'em all over everything you do.
h:
“Values are like fingerprints. Nobody's are the same, but you leave 'em all over everything you do.” —
Elvis Presley

q: Information changes your mind. Action changes your circumstances.
h:
“Information changes your mind. Action changes your circumstances.” —
Jack Butcher

q: Love and compassion are necessities, not luxuries. Without them, humanity cannot survive.
h:
“Love and compassion are necessities, not luxuries. Without them, humanity cannot survive.” —
Dalai Lama

q: Surround yourself only with people who are going to take you higher.
h:
“Surround yourself only with people who are going to take you higher.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: The measure of wisdom is how calm you are when facing any given situation.
h:
“The measure of wisdom is how calm you are when facing any given situation.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: The ego wants to go fast. The soul needs to go slow.
h:
“The ego wants to go fast. The soul needs to go slow.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Your only limitations are those you set up in your mind or permit others to set up for you.
h:
“Your only limitations are those you set up in your mind or permit others to set up for you.” —
Og Mandino

q: Live your life and forget your age.
h:
“Live your life and forget your age.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Today is the oldest you've ever been, and the youngest you'll ever be again.
h:
“Today is the oldest you've ever been, and the youngest you'll ever be again.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Growth comes at the point of resistance.
h:
“Growth comes at the point of resistance.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: Art is to console those who are broken by life.
h:
“Art is to console those who are broken by life.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: The man who does not value himself, cannot value anything or anyone.
h:
“The man who does not value himself, cannot value anything or anyone.” —
Ayn Rand

q: The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me.
h:
“The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me.” —
Ayn Rand

q: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.
h:
“No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Our virtues and our failings are inseparable, like force and matter. When they separate, man is no more.
h:
“Our virtues and our failings are inseparable, like force and matter. When they separate, man is no more. ” —
Nikola Tesla

q: Peace is the result of retraining your mind to process life as it is, rather than as you think it should be.
h:
“Peace is the result of retraining your mind to process life as it is, rather than as you think it should be. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: A strong man overcomes an obstacle, a wise man goes the whole way.
h:
“A strong man overcomes an obstacle, a wise man goes the whole way.” —
Zen Proverb

q: If we all did the things we are capable of doing, we would literally astound ourselves.
h:
“If we all did the things we are capable of doing, we would literally astound ourselves.” —
Thomas Edison

q: To earn more you must learn more.
h:
“To earn more you must learn more.” —
Brian Tracy

q: We run to win, not just to be in the race.
h:
“We run to win, not just to be in the race. ” —
Vince Lombardi

q: The quality of your life is determined by the quality of questions you ask.
h:
“The quality of your life is determined by the quality of questions you ask.” —
Tony Robbins

q: What people say, what people do, and what they say they do are entirely different things.
h:
“What people say, what people do, and what they say they do are entirely different things. ” —
Margaret Mead

q: Throw your heart over the bar and your body will follow.
h:
“Throw your heart over the bar and your body will follow.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: My actions are my only true belongings. I cannot escape the consequences of my actions. My actions are the ground upon which I stand.
h:
“My actions are my only true belongings. I cannot escape the consequences of my actions. My actions are the ground upon which I stand.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: The world only exists in your eyes. You can make it as big or as small as you want.
h:
“The world only exists in your eyes. You can make it as big or as small as you want.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: Be curious, not judgmental.
h:
“Be curious, not judgmental.” —
Walt Whitman

q: Associate yourself with men of good quality, if you esteem your own reputation; for 'tis better to be alone than in bad company.
h:
“Associate yourself with men of good quality, if you esteem your own reputation; for 'tis better to be alone than in bad company. ” —
George Washington

q: The chief cause of failure and unhappiness is trading what you want most for what you want right now.
h:
“The chief cause of failure and unhappiness is trading what you want most for what you want right now.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: People are weird. When we find someone with weirdness that is compatible with ours, we team up and call it love.
h:
“People are weird. When we find someone with weirdness that is compatible with ours, we team up and call it love.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: What one does is what counts. Not what one had the intention of doing.
h:
“What one does is what counts. Not what one had the intention of doing.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: As you think, you travel, and as you love, you attract.
h:
“As you think, you travel, and as you love, you attract.” —
James Allen

q: You don't have to control your thoughts; you just have to stop letting them control you.
h:
“You don't have to control your thoughts; you just have to stop letting them control you.” —
Dan Millman

q: Live calmly. The time will come when the flowers bloom by themselves.
h:
“Live calmly. The time will come when the flowers bloom by themselves.” —
Zen Proverb

q: The smallest of actions is always better than the noblest of intentions.
h:
“The smallest of actions is always better than the noblest of intentions.” —

q: Don't be afraid that you do not know something. Be afraid of not learning about it.
h:
“Don't be afraid that you do not know something. Be afraid of not learning about it.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Be patient and calm; no one can catch fish in anger.
h:
“Be patient and calm; no one can catch fish in anger.” —
Herbert Hoover

q: Stop wasting time looking at someone else's reality while doing nothing about yours.
h:
“Stop wasting time looking at someone else's reality while doing nothing about yours.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending.
h:
“Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending.” —
Carl Bard

q: If you aren't sure which way to do something, do it both ways and see which works better.
h:
“If you aren't sure which way to do something, do it both ways and see which works better.” —
John Carmack

q: Among the things you can give and still keep are your word, a smile, and a grateful heart.
h:
“Among the things you can give and still keep are your word, a smile, and a grateful heart.” —

q: We turn not older with years but newer every day.
h:
“We turn not older with years but newer every day.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: It does not matter how slowly you go so long as you do not stop.
h:
“It does not matter how slowly you go so long as you do not stop.” —
Confucius

q: Light a candle instead of cursing the darkness.
h:
“Light a candle instead of cursing the darkness.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Make failure your teacher, not your undertaker.
h:
“Make failure your teacher, not your undertaker. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Adults are just children who earn money.
h:
“Adults are just children who earn money.” —

q: The less you respond to negative people, the more positive your life will become.
h:
“The less you respond to negative people, the more positive your life will become.” —

q: Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.
h:
“Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.” —
Aristotle

q: Help others achieve their dreams and you will achieve yours.
h:
“Help others achieve their dreams and you will achieve yours.” —
Les Brown

q: The river that flows in you also flows in me.
h:
“The river that flows in you also flows in me.” —
Kabir

q: Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion, and knowledge.
h:
“Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion, and knowledge.” —
Plato

q: Man is affected not by events but by the view he takes of them.
h:
“Man is affected not by events but by the view he takes of them. ” —
Seneca

q: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.
h:
“Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: If you want to turn a vision into reality, you have to give 100% and never stop believing in your dream.
h:
“If you want to turn a vision into reality, you have to give 100% and never stop believing in your dream.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger

q: Live your life and forget your age.
h:
“Live your life and forget your age.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Don't be afraid that you do not know something. Be afraid of not learning about it.
h:
“Don't be afraid that you do not know something. Be afraid of not learning about it.” —
Zen Proverb

q: A vital part of the happiness formula is self-discipline. Whoever conquers himself knows deep happiness that fills the heart with joy.
h:
“A vital part of the happiness formula is self-discipline. Whoever conquers himself knows deep happiness that fills the heart with joy.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
h:
“Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage. ” —
Lao Tzu

q: Life is like a wheel. Sooner or later, it always comes around to where you started again.
h:
“Life is like a wheel. Sooner or later, it always comes around to where you started again.” —
Stephen King

q: If you don't like something, change it. If you can't change it, change your attitude.
h:
“If you don't like something, change it. If you can't change it, change your attitude.” —
Maya Angelou

q: The power of man has grown in every sphere, except over himself.
h:
“The power of man has grown in every sphere, except over himself.” —
Winston Churchill

q: If you want to change how you see your problems, you have to change what you value and/or how you measure failure/success.
h:
“If you want to change how you see your problems, you have to change what you value and/or how you measure failure/success.” —
Mark Manson

q: Peace begins with a smile.
h:
“Peace begins with a smile.” —
Mother Teresa

q: The moment you stop to think about whether you love someone, you've already stopped loving that person forever.
h:
“The moment you stop to think about whether you love someone, you've already stopped loving that person forever.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: To injure an opponent is to injure yourself. To control aggression without inflicting injury is the Art of Peace.
h:
“To injure an opponent is to injure yourself. To control aggression without inflicting injury is the Art of Peace.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: Doubt is an uncomfortable condition, but certainty is a ridiculous one.
h:
“Doubt is an uncomfortable condition, but certainty is a ridiculous one.” —
Voltaire

q: Opportunities don't often come along. So, when they do, you have to grab them.
h:
“Opportunities don't often come along. So, when they do, you have to grab them.” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: Be gentle with yourself. Think less and feel more. Be as happy as you can. You only have this moment.
h:
“Be gentle with yourself. Think less and feel more. Be as happy as you can. You only have this moment.” —
Dan Millman

q: Insanity is relative. It depends on who has who locked in what cage.
h:
“Insanity is relative. It depends on who has who locked in what cage. ” —
Ray Bradbury

q: Engage in those actions and thoughts that nurture the good qualities you want to have.
h:
“Engage in those actions and thoughts that nurture the good qualities you want to have.” —

q: Success is an iceberg.
h:
“Success is an iceberg.” —
Unknown

q: You use a glass mirror to see your face; you use works of art to see your soul.
h:
“You use a glass mirror to see your face; you use works of art to see your soul.” —

q: Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.
h:
“Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.” —
Buddha

q: The most important battle is one to conquer yourself.
h:
“The most important battle is one to conquer yourself.” —
Yanni

q: First comes the shy wish. Then you must have the heart to have the dream. Then, you work, and work.
h:

Estee Lauder

q: We can have more than we've got because we can become more than we are.
h:

Jim Rohn

q: Your worth consists in what you are and not in what you have.
h:
“Your worth consists in what you are and not in what you have.” —
Thomas Edison

q: People who avoid failure also avoid success.
h:
“People who avoid failure also avoid success.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Many have died; you also will die. The drum of death is being beaten. The world has fallen in love with a dream. Only sayings of the wise will remain.
h:

Kabir

q: No snowflake ever falls in the wrong place.
h:
“No snowflake ever falls in the wrong place.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Don't set your own goals by what other people make important.
h:
“Don't set your own goals by what other people make important.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: The only time you run out of chances is when you stop taking them.
h:
“The only time you run out of chances is when you stop taking them.” —
Unknown

q: Quiet people have the loudest minds.
h:
“Quiet people have the loudest minds.” —
Stephen King

q: Discipline is the mark of intelligent living.
h:
“Discipline is the mark of intelligent living.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: Chase your passion, not your pension.
h:
“Chase your passion, not your pension. ” —
Denis Waitley

q: Trusting our intuition often saves us from disaster.
h:
“Trusting our intuition often saves us from disaster. ” —

q: It is literally true that you can succeed best and quickest by helping others succeed.
h:
“It is literally true that you can succeed best and quickest by helping others succeed.” —

q: Humor isn't for everyone. It's only for people who want to have fun, enjoy life, and feel alive.
h:

Anne Wilson Schaef

q: Raise your words, not voice. It is rain that grows flowers, not thunder.

Rumi

q: Challenge yourself to find the good and beautiful thing inside of everyone.

q: The journey is what brings us happiness not the destination.
h:
“The journey is what brings us happiness not the destination.” —

q: If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow.
h:
“If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow. ” —

q: Realize deeply that the present moment is all you have. Make the NOW the primary focus of your life.
h:

q: Wake up and smile! Wake up and be grateful!
h:

q: When things go wrong, don't go with them.
h:
“When things go wrong, don't go with them.” —

q: There is no path to Peace. Peace is the path.
h:
“There is no path to Peace. Peace is the path.” —

q: Never give up on a dream just because of the time it will take to accomplish it. The time will pass anyway.
h:

q: Constantly seek criticism. A well thought out critique of whatever you're doing is as valuable as gold.
h:

q: Health is the greatest of all possessions.
h:
“Health is the greatest of all possessions.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: He who can, does.
h:
“He who can, does.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Everyone must choose one of two pains: The pain of discipline or the pain of regret.
h:
“Everyone must choose one of two pains: The pain of discipline or the pain of regret.” —

q: Yesterday is but today's memory, tomorrow is today's dream.
h:

q: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.
h:
